segment.source: Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment
segment.target: Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment

segment.source: Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment
segment.target: Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment

segment.source: Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment
segment.target: Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment

segment.source: There is some planning and preparation to do before you deploy Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 or 2.1 as a solution for synchronizing settings between devices that users access in your enterprise.
segment.target: There is some planning and preparation to do before you deploy Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 or 2.1 as a solution for synchronizing settings between devices that users access in your enterprise.

segment.source: This topic helps you determine what type of deployment you'll be doing and what preparation you can make beforehand so that your deployment is successful.
segment.target: This topic helps you determine what type of deployment you'll be doing and what preparation you can make beforehand so that your deployment is successful.

segment.source: First, let’s look at the tasks you’ll do to deploy UE-V:
segment.target: First, let’s look at the tasks you’ll do to deploy UE-V:

segment.source: Plan your UE-V Deployment
segment.target: Plan your UE-V Deployment

segment.source: Before you deploy anything, a good first step is to do a little bit of planning so that you can determine which UE-V features you’ll deploy.
segment.target: Before you deploy anything, a good first step is to do a little bit of planning so that you can determine which UE-V features you’ll deploy.

segment.source: So if you leave this page, make sure you come back and read through the planning information below.
segment.target: So if you leave this page, make sure you come back and read through the planning information below.

segment.source: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Deploy Required Features for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Every UE-V deployment requires these activities:
segment.target: Every UE-V deployment requires these activities:

segment.source: Define a settings storage location
segment.target: Define a settings storage location

segment.source: Decide how to deploy the UE-V Agent and manage UE-V configurations
segment.target: Decide how to deploy the UE-V Agent and manage UE-V configurations

segment.source: Install the UE-V Agent on every user computer that needs settings synchronized
segment.target: Install the UE-V Agent on every user computer that needs settings synchronized

segment.source: Optionally, you can Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications
segment.target: Optionally, you can Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications

segment.source: Planning will help you figure out whether you want UE-V to support the synchronization of settings for custom applications (third-party or line-of-business), which requires these UE-V features:
segment.target: Planning will help you figure out whether you want UE-V to support the synchronization of settings for custom applications (third-party or line-of-business), which requires these UE-V features:

segment.source: Install the UEV Generator so you can create, edit, and validate the custom settings location templates required to synchronize custom application settings
segment.target: Install the UEV Generator so you can create, edit, and validate the custom settings location templates required to synchronize custom application settings

segment.source: Create custom settings location templates by using the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Create custom settings location templates by using the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Deploy a UE-V settings template catalog that you use to store your custom settings location templates
segment.target: Deploy a UE-V settings template catalog that you use to store your custom settings location templates

segment.source: This workflow diagram provides a high-level understanding of a UE-V deployment and the decisions that determine how you deploy UE-V in your enterprise.
segment.target: This workflow diagram provides a high-level understanding of a UE-V deployment and the decisions that determine how you deploy UE-V in your enterprise.

segment.source: deploymentworkflow
segment.target: deploymentworkflow

segment.source: Planning a UE-V deployment: First, you want to do a little bit of planning so that you can determine which UE-V components you’ll be deploying.
segment.target: Planning a UE-V deployment: First, you want to do a little bit of planning so that you can determine which UE-V components you’ll be deploying.

segment.source: Planning a UE-V deployment involves these things:
segment.target: Planning a UE-V deployment involves these things:

segment.source: Decide whether to synchronize settings for custom applications
segment.target: Decide whether to synchronize settings for custom applications

segment.source: This determines whether you will install the UE-V Generator during deployment, which lets you create custom settings location templates.
segment.target: This determines whether you will install the UE-V Generator during deployment, which lets you create custom settings location templates.

segment.source: It involves the following:
segment.target: It involves the following:

segment.source: Review the settings that are synchronized automatically in a UE-V deployment.
segment.target: Review the settings that are synchronized automatically in a UE-V deployment.

segment.source: Determine whether you need settings synchronized for other applications.
segment.target: Determine whether you need settings synchronized for other applications.

segment.source: Review other considerations for deploying UE-V, such as high availability and capacity planning.
segment.target: Review other considerations for deploying UE-V, such as high availability and capacity planning.

segment.source: Confirm prerequisites and supported configurations for UE-V
segment.target: Confirm prerequisites and supported configurations for UE-V

segment.source: Decide Whether to Synchronize Settings for Custom Applications
segment.target: Decide Whether to Synchronize Settings for Custom Applications

segment.source: In a UE-V deployment, many settings are automatically synchronized.
segment.target: In a UE-V deployment, many settings are automatically synchronized.

segment.source: But you can also customize UE-V to synchronize settings for other applications, such as line-of-business and third-party apps.
segment.target: But you can also customize UE-V to synchronize settings for other applications, such as line-of-business and third-party apps.

segment.source: Deciding if you want UE-V to synchronize settings for custom applications is probably the most important part of planning your UE-V deployment.
segment.target: Deciding if you want UE-V to synchronize settings for custom applications is probably the most important part of planning your UE-V deployment.

segment.source: The topics in this section will help you make that decision.
segment.target: The topics in this section will help you make that decision.

segment.source: Settings that are automatically synchronized in a UE-V deployment
segment.target: Settings that are automatically synchronized in a UE-V deployment

segment.source: This section provides information about the settings that are synchronized by default in UE-V, including the following:
segment.target: This section provides information about the settings that are synchronized by default in UE-V, including the following:

segment.source: Desktop applications whose settings are synchronized by default
segment.target: Desktop applications whose settings are synchronized by default

segment.source: Windows desktop settings that are synchronized by default
segment.target: Windows desktop settings that are synchronized by default

segment.source: A statement of support for Windows app setting synchronization
segment.target: A statement of support for Windows app setting synchronization

segment.source: See User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) settings templates for Microsoft Office to download a complete list of the specific Microsoft Office 2013, Microsoft Office 2010, and Microsoft Office 2007 settings that are synchronized by UE-V.
segment.target: See User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) settings templates for Microsoft Office to download a complete list of the specific Microsoft Office 2013, Microsoft Office 2010, and Microsoft Office 2007 settings that are synchronized by UE-V.

segment.source: Desktop applications synchronized by default in UE-V 2.1 and UE-V 2.1 SP1
segment.target: Desktop applications synchronized by default in UE-V 2.1 and UE-V 2.1 SP1

segment.source: When you install the UE-V 2.1 or 2.1 SP1 Agent, it registers a default group of settings location templates that capture settings values for these common Microsoft applications.
segment.target: When you install the UE-V 2.1 or 2.1 SP1 Agent, it registers a default group of settings location templates that capture settings values for these common Microsoft applications.

segment.source: Tip
segment.target: Tip

segment.source: Microsoft Office 2007 Settings Synchronization – In UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1, a settings location template is no longer included by default for Office 2007 applications.
segment.target: Microsoft Office 2007 Settings Synchronization – In UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1, a settings location template is no longer included by default for Office 2007 applications.

segment.source: However, you can still use Office 2007 templates from UE-V 2.0 or earlier and can get the templates from the UE-V template gallery.
segment.target: However, you can still use Office 2007 templates from UE-V 2.0 or earlier and can get the templates from the UE-V template gallery.

segment.source: The UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 Microsoft Office 2013 settings location templates include improved Outlook signature support.
segment.target: The UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 Microsoft Office 2013 settings location templates include improved Outlook signature support.

segment.source: We’ve added synchronization of default signature settings for new, reply, and forwarded emails.
segment.target: We’ve added synchronization of default signature settings for new, reply, and forwarded emails.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: An Outlook profile must be created for any device on which a user wants to sync their Outlook signature.
segment.target: An Outlook profile must be created for any device on which a user wants to sync their Outlook signature.

segment.source: If the profile is not already created, the user can create one and then restart Outlook on that device to enable signature synchronization.
segment.target: If the profile is not already created, the user can create one and then restart Outlook on that device to enable signature synchronization.

segment.target: UE-V does not roam settings for Internet Explorer cookies.

segment.target: UE-V 2.1 SP1 does not synchronize settings between the Microsoft Calculator in Windows 10 and the Microsoft Calculator in previous operating systems.

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Starting in Windows 8, UE-V does not roam settings related to the Start screen, such as items and locations.
segment.target: Starting in Windows 8, UE-V does not roam settings related to the Start screen, such as items and locations.

segment.source: In addition, UE-V does not support synchronization of pinned taskbar items or Windows file shortcuts.
segment.target: In addition, UE-V does not support synchronization of pinned taskbar items or Windows file shortcuts.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: UE-V 2.1 SP1 roams taskbar settings between Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: UE-V 2.1 SP1 roams taskbar settings between Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: However, UE-V does not synchronize taskbar settings between Windows 10 devices and devices running previous operating systems.
segment.target: However, UE-V does not synchronize taskbar settings between Windows 10 devices and devices running previous operating systems.

segment.source: UE-V-support for Windows Apps
segment.target: UE-V-support for Windows Apps

segment.source: For Windows apps, the app developer specifies the settings that are synchronized.
segment.target: For Windows apps, the app developer specifies the settings that are synchronized.

segment.source: You can specify which Windows apps are enabled for settings synchronization.
segment.target: You can specify which Windows apps are enabled for settings synchronization.

segment.source: To display a list of Windows apps that can synchronize settings on a computer with their package family name, enabled status, and enabled source, at a Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:
segment.target: To display a list of Windows apps that can synchronize settings on a computer with their package family name, enabled status, and enabled source, at a Windows PowerShell command prompt, enter:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: As of Windows 8, UE-V does not synchronize Windows app settings if the domain user links their sign-in credentials to their Microsoft Account.
segment.target: As of Windows 8, UE-V does not synchronize Windows app settings if the domain user links their sign-in credentials to their Microsoft Account.

segment.source: This linking synchronizes settings to Microsoft OneDrive so UE-V, which disables synchronization of Windows app settings.
segment.target: This linking synchronizes settings to Microsoft OneDrive so UE-V, which disables synchronization of Windows app settings.

segment.source: UE-V-support for Roaming Printers
segment.target: UE-V-support for Roaming Printers

segment.source: UE-V 2.1 SP1 lets network printers roam between devices so that a user has access to their network printers when logged on to any device on the network.
segment.target: UE-V 2.1 SP1 lets network printers roam between devices so that a user has access to their network printers when logged on to any device on the network.

segment.source: This includes roaming the printer that they set as the default.
segment.target: This includes roaming the printer that they set as the default.

segment.source: Printer roaming in UE-V requires one of these scenarios:
segment.target: Printer roaming in UE-V requires one of these scenarios:

segment.source: The print server can download the required driver when it roams to a new device.
segment.target: The print server can download the required driver when it roams to a new device.

segment.source: The driver for the roaming network printer is pre-installed on any device that needs to access that network printer.
segment.target: The driver for the roaming network printer is pre-installed on any device that needs to access that network printer.

segment.source: The printer driver can be obtained from Windows Update.
segment.target: The printer driver can be obtained from Windows Update.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The UE-V printer roaming feature does not roam printer settings or preferences, such as printing double-sided.
segment.target: The UE-V printer roaming feature does not roam printer settings or preferences, such as printing double-sided.

segment.source: Determine whether you need settings synchronized for other applications
segment.target: Determine whether you need settings synchronized for other applications

segment.source: After you have reviewed the settings that are synchronized automatically in a UE-V deployment, you want to decide whether you will synchronize settings for other applications since this determines how you deploy UE-V throughout your enterprise.
segment.target: After you have reviewed the settings that are synchronized automatically in a UE-V deployment, you want to decide whether you will synchronize settings for other applications since this determines how you deploy UE-V throughout your enterprise.

segment.source: As an administrator, when you consider which desktop applications to include in your UE-V solution, consider which settings can be customized by users, and how and where the application stores its settings.
segment.target: As an administrator, when you consider which desktop applications to include in your UE-V solution, consider which settings can be customized by users, and how and where the application stores its settings.

segment.source: Not all desktop applications have settings that can be customized or that are routinely customized by users.
segment.target: Not all desktop applications have settings that can be customized or that are routinely customized by users.

segment.source: In addition, not all desktop applications settings can safely be synchronized across multiple computers or environments.
segment.target: In addition, not all desktop applications settings can safely be synchronized across multiple computers or environments.

segment.source: In general, you can synchronize settings that meet the following criteria:
segment.target: In general, you can synchronize settings that meet the following criteria:

segment.source: Settings that are stored in user-accessible locations.
segment.target: Settings that are stored in user-accessible locations.

segment.source: For example, do not synchronize settings that are stored in System32 or outside the HKEYCURRENTUSER (HKCU) section of the registry.
segment.target: For example, do not synchronize settings that are stored in System32 or outside the HKEYCURRENTUSER (HKCU) section of the registry.

segment.source: Settings that are not specific to the particular computer.
segment.target: Settings that are not specific to the particular computer.

segment.source: For example, exclude network or hardware configurations.
segment.target: For example, exclude network or hardware configurations.

segment.source: Settings that can be synchronized between computers without risk of corrupted data.
segment.target: Settings that can be synchronized between computers without risk of corrupted data.

segment.source: For example, do not use settings that are stored in a database file.
segment.target: For example, do not use settings that are stored in a database file.

segment.source: Checklist for evaluating custom applications
segment.target: Checklist for evaluating custom applications

segment.source: If you’ve decided that you need settings synchronized for other applications, you can use this checklist to help figure out which applications you’ll include.
segment.target: If you’ve decided that you need settings synchronized for other applications, you can use this checklist to help figure out which applications you’ll include.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Does this application contain settings that the user can customize?
segment.target: Does this application contain settings that the user can customize?

segment.source: Is it important for the user that these settings are synchronized?
segment.target: Is it important for the user that these settings are synchronized?

segment.source: Are these user settings already managed by an application management or settings policy solution?
segment.target: Are these user settings already managed by an application management or settings policy solution?

segment.source: UE-V applies application settings at application startup and Windows settings at logon, unlock, or remote connect events.
segment.target: UE-V applies application settings at application startup and Windows settings at logon, unlock, or remote connect events.

segment.source: If you use UE-V with other settings sharing solutions, users might experience inconsistency across synchronized settings.
segment.target: If you use UE-V with other settings sharing solutions, users might experience inconsistency across synchronized settings.

segment.source: Are the application settings specific to the computer?
segment.target: Are the application settings specific to the computer?

segment.source: Application preferences and customizations that are associated with hardware or specific computer configurations do not consistently synchronize across sessions and can cause a poor application experience.
segment.target: Application preferences and customizations that are associated with hardware or specific computer configurations do not consistently synchronize across sessions and can cause a poor application experience.

segment.source: Does the application store settings in the Program Files directory or in the file directory that is located in the UsersUser name]\AppDataLocalLow directory?
segment.target: Does the application store settings in the Program Files directory or in the file directory that is located in the UsersUser name]\AppDataLocalLow directory?

segment.source: Application data that is stored in either of these locations usually should not synchronize with the user, because this data is specific to the computer or because the data is too large to synchronize.
segment.target: Application data that is stored in either of these locations usually should not synchronize with the user, because this data is specific to the computer or because the data is too large to synchronize.

segment.source: Does the application store any settings in a file that contains other application data that should not synchronize?
segment.target: Does the application store any settings in a file that contains other application data that should not synchronize?

segment.source: UE-V synchronizes files as a single unit.
segment.target: UE-V synchronizes files as a single unit.

segment.source: If settings are stored in files that include application data other than settings, then synchronizing this additional data can cause a poor application experience.
segment.target: If settings are stored in files that include application data other than settings, then synchronizing this additional data can cause a poor application experience.

segment.source: How large are the files that contain the settings?
segment.target: How large are the files that contain the settings?

segment.source: The performance of the settings synchronization can be affected by large files.
segment.target: The performance of the settings synchronization can be affected by large files.

segment.source: Including large files can affect the performance of settings synchronization.
segment.target: Including large files can affect the performance of settings synchronization.

segment.source: Other Considerations when Preparing a UE-V Deployment
segment.target: Other Considerations when Preparing a UE-V Deployment

segment.source: You should also consider these things when you are preparing to deploy UE-V:
segment.target: You should also consider these things when you are preparing to deploy UE-V:

segment.source: Managing credentials synchronization
segment.target: Managing credentials synchronization

segment.source: Windows app settings synchronization
segment.target: Windows app settings synchronization

segment.source: Custom UE-V settings location templates
segment.target: Custom UE-V settings location templates

segment.source: Unintentional user settings configurations
segment.target: Unintentional user settings configurations

segment.source: Performance and capacity
segment.target: Performance and capacity

segment.source: High availability
segment.target: High availability

segment.source: Computer clock synchronization
segment.target: Computer clock synchronization

segment.source: Managing credentials synchronization in UE-V 2.1 and UE-V 2.1 SP1
segment.target: Managing credentials synchronization in UE-V 2.1 and UE-V 2.1 SP1

segment.source: Many enterprise applications, including Microsoft Outlook and Lync, prompt users for their domain credentials at login.
segment.target: Many enterprise applications, including Microsoft Outlook and Lync, prompt users for their domain credentials at login.

segment.source: Users have the option of saving their credentials to disk to prevent having to enter them every time they open these applications.
segment.target: Users have the option of saving their credentials to disk to prevent having to enter them every time they open these applications.

segment.source: Enabling roaming credentials synchronization lets users save their credentials on one computer and avoid re-entering them on every computer they use in their environment.
segment.target: Enabling roaming credentials synchronization lets users save their credentials on one computer and avoid re-entering them on every computer they use in their environment.

segment.source: Users can synchronize some domain credentials with UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1.
segment.target: Users can synchronize some domain credentials with UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Credentials synchronization is disabled by default.
segment.target: Credentials synchronization is disabled by default.

segment.source: You must explicitly enable credentials synchronization during deployment to implement this feature.
segment.target: You must explicitly enable credentials synchronization during deployment to implement this feature.

segment.source: UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 can synchronize enterprise credentials, but do not roam credentials intended only for use on the local computer.
segment.target: UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 can synchronize enterprise credentials, but do not roam credentials intended only for use on the local computer.

segment.source: Credentials are synchronous settings, meaning they are applied to your profile the first time you log in to your computer after UE-V synchronizes.
segment.target: Credentials are synchronous settings, meaning they are applied to your profile the first time you log in to your computer after UE-V synchronizes.

segment.source: Credentials synchronization is managed by its own settings location template, which is disabled by default.
segment.target: Credentials synchronization is managed by its own settings location template, which is disabled by default.

segment.source: You can enable or disable this template through the same methods used for other templates.
segment.target: You can enable or disable this template through the same methods used for other templates.

segment.source: The template identifier for this feature is RoamingCredentialSettings.
segment.target: The template identifier for this feature is RoamingCredentialSettings.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are using Active Directory Credential Roaming in your environment, we recommend that you don’t enable the UE-V credential roaming template.
segment.target: If you are using Active Directory Credential Roaming in your environment, we recommend that you don’t enable the UE-V credential roaming template.

segment.source: Use one of these methods to enable credentials synchronization:
segment.target: Use one of these methods to enable credentials synchronization:

segment.source: Company Settings Center
segment.target: Company Settings Center

segment.source: PowerShell
segment.target: PowerShell

segment.source: Group Policy
segment.target: Group Policy

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Credentials are encrypted during synchronization.
segment.target: Credentials are encrypted during synchronization.

segment.source: Company Settings Center : Check the Roaming Credential Settings check box under Windows Settings to enable credential synchronization.
segment.target: Company Settings Center : Check the Roaming Credential Settings check box under Windows Settings to enable credential synchronization.

segment.source: Uncheck the box to disable it.
segment.target: Uncheck the box to disable it.

segment.source: This check box only appears in Company Settings Center if your account is not configured to synchronize settings using a Microsoft Account.
segment.target: This check box only appears in Company Settings Center if your account is not configured to synchronize settings using a Microsoft Account.

segment.source: PowerShell : This PowerShell cmdlet enables credential synchronization:
segment.target: PowerShell : This PowerShell cmdlet enables credential synchronization:

segment.source: This PowerShell cmdlet disables credential synchronization:
segment.target: This PowerShell cmdlet disables credential synchronization:

segment.source: Group Policy : You must deploy the latest MDOP ADMX template to enable credential synchronization through group policy.
segment.target: Group Policy : You must deploy the latest MDOP ADMX template to enable credential synchronization through group policy.

segment.source: Credentials synchronization is managed with the Windows settings.
segment.target: Credentials synchronization is managed with the Windows settings.

segment.source: To manage this feature with Group Policy, enable the Synchronize Windows settings policy.
segment.target: To manage this feature with Group Policy, enable the Synchronize Windows settings policy.

segment.source: Open Group Policy Editor and navigate to User Configuration – Administrative Templates – Windows Components – Microsoft User Experience Virtualization.
segment.target: Open Group Policy Editor and navigate to User Configuration – Administrative Templates – Windows Components – Microsoft User Experience Virtualization.

segment.source: Double-click on Synchronize Windows settings.
segment.target: Double-click on Synchronize Windows settings.

segment.source: If this policy is enabled, you can enable credentials synchronization by checking the Roaming Credentials check box, or disable credentials synchronization by unchecking it.
segment.target: If this policy is enabled, you can enable credentials synchronization by checking the Roaming Credentials check box, or disable credentials synchronization by unchecking it.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Credential locations synchronized by UE-V
segment.target: Credential locations synchronized by UE-V

segment.source: Credential files saved by applications into the following locations are synchronized:
segment.target: Credential files saved by applications into the following locations are synchronized:

segment.source: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftCredentials
segment.target: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftCredentials

segment.source: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftCrypto
segment.target: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftCrypto

segment.source: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftProtect
segment.target: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftProtect

segment.source: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftSystemCertificates
segment.target: %UserProfile%AppDataRoamingMicrosoftSystemCertificates

segment.source: Credentials saved to other locations are not synchronized by UE-V.
segment.target: Credentials saved to other locations are not synchronized by UE-V.

segment.source: Windows app settings synchronization
segment.target: Windows app settings synchronization

segment.source: UE-V manages Windows app settings synchronization in three ways:
segment.target: UE-V manages Windows app settings synchronization in three ways:

segment.source: Sync Windows Apps: Allow or deny any Windows app synchronization
segment.target: Sync Windows Apps: Allow or deny any Windows app synchronization

segment.source: Windows App List: Synchronize a list of Windows apps
segment.target: Windows App List: Synchronize a list of Windows apps

segment.source: Unlisted Default Sync Behavior: Determine the synchronization behavior of Windows apps that are not in the Windows app list.
segment.target: Unlisted Default Sync Behavior: Determine the synchronization behavior of Windows apps that are not in the Windows app list.

segment.source: For more information, see the Windows App List.
segment.target: For more information, see the Windows App List.

segment.source: Custom UE-V settings location templates
segment.target: Custom UE-V settings location templates

segment.source: If you are deploying UE-V to synchronize settings for custom applications, you will use the UE-V Generator to create custom settings location templates for those desktop applications.
segment.target: If you are deploying UE-V to synchronize settings for custom applications, you will use the UE-V Generator to create custom settings location templates for those desktop applications.

segment.source: After you create and test a custom settings location template in a test environment, you can deploy the settings location templates to computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: After you create and test a custom settings location template in a test environment, you can deploy the settings location templates to computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Custom settings location templates must be deployed with an existing deployment infrastructure, like an enterprise software distribution (ESD) method such as System Center Configuration Manager, with preferences, or by configuring an UE-V settings template catalog.
segment.target: Custom settings location templates must be deployed with an existing deployment infrastructure, like an enterprise software distribution (ESD) method such as System Center Configuration Manager, with preferences, or by configuring an UE-V settings template catalog.

segment.source: Templates that are deployed with Configuration Manager or Group Policy must be registered by using UE-V WMI or Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Templates that are deployed with Configuration Manager or Group Policy must be registered by using UE-V WMI or Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: For more information about custom settings location templates, see Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.
segment.target: For more information about custom settings location templates, see Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.

segment.source: For more information about using UE-V with Configuration Manager, see Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012.
segment.target: For more information about using UE-V with Configuration Manager, see Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012.

segment.source: Prevent unintentional user settings configuration
segment.target: Prevent unintentional user settings configuration

segment.source: UE-V downloads new user settings information from a settings storage location and applies the settings to the local computer in these instances:
segment.target: UE-V downloads new user settings information from a settings storage location and applies the settings to the local computer in these instances:

segment.source: Every time an application is started that has a registered UE-V template.
segment.target: Every time an application is started that has a registered UE-V template.

segment.source: When a user logs on to a computer.
segment.target: When a user logs on to a computer.

segment.source: When a user unlocks a computer.
segment.target: When a user unlocks a computer.

segment.source: When a connection is made to a remote desktop computer that has UE-V installed.
segment.target: When a connection is made to a remote desktop computer that has UE-V installed.

segment.source: When the Sync Controller Application scheduled task is run.
segment.target: When the Sync Controller Application scheduled task is run.

segment.source: If UE-V is installed on computer A and computer B, and the settings that you want for the application are on computer A, then computer A should open and close the application first.
segment.target: If UE-V is installed on computer A and computer B, and the settings that you want for the application are on computer A, then computer A should open and close the application first.

segment.source: If the application is opened and closed on computer B first, then the application settings on computer A are configured to the application settings on computer B. Settings are synchronized between computers on per-application basis.
segment.target: If the application is opened and closed on computer B first, then the application settings on computer A are configured to the application settings on computer B. Settings are synchronized between computers on per-application basis.

segment.source: Over time, settings become consistent between computers as they are opened and closed with preferred settings.
segment.target: Over time, settings become consistent between computers as they are opened and closed with preferred settings.

segment.source: This scenario also applies to Windows settings.
segment.target: This scenario also applies to Windows settings.

segment.source: If the Windows settings on computer B should be the same as the Windows settings on computer A, then the user should log on and log off computer A first.
segment.target: If the Windows settings on computer B should be the same as the Windows settings on computer A, then the user should log on and log off computer A first.

segment.source: If the user settings that the user wants are applied in the wrong order, they can be recovered by performing a restore operation for the specific application or Windows configuration on the computer on which the settings were overwritten.
segment.target: If the user settings that the user wants are applied in the wrong order, they can be recovered by performing a restore operation for the specific application or Windows configuration on the computer on which the settings were overwritten.

segment.source: For more information, see Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x.
segment.target: For more information, see Manage Administrative Backup and Restore in UE-V 2.x.

segment.source: Performance and capacity planning
segment.target: Performance and capacity planning

segment.source: Specify your requirements for UE-V with standard disk capacity and network health monitoring.
segment.target: Specify your requirements for UE-V with standard disk capacity and network health monitoring.

segment.source: UE-V uses a Server Message Block (SMB) share for the storage of settings packages.
segment.target: UE-V uses a Server Message Block (SMB) share for the storage of settings packages.

segment.source: The size of settings packages varies depending on the settings information for each application.
segment.target: The size of settings packages varies depending on the settings information for each application.

segment.source: While most settings packages are small, the synchronization of potentially large files, such as desktop images, can result in poor performance, particularly on slower networks.
segment.target: While most settings packages are small, the synchronization of potentially large files, such as desktop images, can result in poor performance, particularly on slower networks.

segment.source: To reduce problems with network latency, create settings storage locations on the same local networks where the users’ computers reside.
segment.target: To reduce problems with network latency, create settings storage locations on the same local networks where the users’ computers reside.

segment.source: We recommend 20 MB of disk space per user for the settings storage location.
segment.target: We recommend 20 MB of disk space per user for the settings storage location.

segment.source: By default, UE-V synchronization times out after 2 seconds to prevent excessive lag due to a large settings package.
segment.target: By default, UE-V synchronization times out after 2 seconds to prevent excessive lag due to a large settings package.

segment.source: You can configure the SyncMethod=SyncProvider setting by using Group Policy Objects.
segment.target: You can configure the SyncMethod=SyncProvider setting by using Group Policy Objects.

segment.source: High Availability for UE-V
segment.target: High Availability for UE-V

segment.source: The UE-V settings storage location and settings template catalog support storing user data on any writable share.
segment.target: The UE-V settings storage location and settings template catalog support storing user data on any writable share.

segment.source: To ensure high availability, follow these criteria:
segment.target: To ensure high availability, follow these criteria:

segment.source: Format the storage volume with an NTFS file system.
segment.target: Format the storage volume with an NTFS file system.

segment.source: The share can use Distributed File System (DFS) replication, but Distributed File System Replication (DFSR) is specifically not supported.
segment.target: The share can use Distributed File System (DFS) replication, but Distributed File System Replication (DFSR) is specifically not supported.

segment.source: Distributed File System Namespaces (DFSN) are supported.
segment.target: Distributed File System Namespaces (DFSN) are supported.

segment.source: For detailed information, see Microsoft’s Support Statement Around Replicated User Profile Data.
segment.target: For detailed information, see Microsoft’s Support Statement Around Replicated User Profile Data.

segment.source: In addition, because SYSVOL uses DFSR for replication, SYSVOL cannot be used for UE-V data file replication.
segment.target: In addition, because SYSVOL uses DFSR for replication, SYSVOL cannot be used for UE-V data file replication.

segment.source: Configure the share permissions and NTFS access control lists (ACLs) as specified in Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 2.x.
segment.target: Configure the share permissions and NTFS access control lists (ACLs) as specified in Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 2.x.

segment.source: Use file server clustering along with the UE-V Agent to provide access to copies of user state data in the event of communications failures.
segment.target: Use file server clustering along with the UE-V Agent to provide access to copies of user state data in the event of communications failures.

segment.source: You can store the settings storage path data (user data) and settings template catalog templates on clustered shares, on DFSN shares, or on both.
segment.target: You can store the settings storage path data (user data) and settings template catalog templates on clustered shares, on DFSN shares, or on both.

segment.source: Synchronize computer clocks for UE-V settings synchronization
segment.target: Synchronize computer clocks for UE-V settings synchronization

segment.source: Computers that run the UE-V Agent must use a time server to maintain a consistent settings experience.
segment.target: Computers that run the UE-V Agent must use a time server to maintain a consistent settings experience.

segment.source: UE-V uses time stamps to determine if settings must be synchronized from the settings storage location.
segment.target: UE-V uses time stamps to determine if settings must be synchronized from the settings storage location.

segment.source: If the computer clock is inaccurate, older settings can overwrite newer settings, or the new settings might not be saved to the settings storage location.
segment.target: If the computer clock is inaccurate, older settings can overwrite newer settings, or the new settings might not be saved to the settings storage location.

segment.source: Confirm Prerequisites and Supported Configurations for UE-V
segment.target: Confirm Prerequisites and Supported Configurations for UE-V

segment.source: Before you proceed, make sure your environment includes these requirements for running UE-V.
segment.target: Before you proceed, make sure your environment includes these requirements for running UE-V.

segment.target: Operating system

segment.source: Edition
segment.target: Edition

segment.source: Service pack
segment.target: Service pack

segment.target: System architecture

segment.target: Windows PowerShell

segment.target: Microsoft .NET Framework

segment.target: Ultimate, Enterprise, or Professional Edition

segment.target: SP1

segment.source: 32-bit or 64-bit
segment.target: 32-bit or 64-bit

segment.source: Windows PowerShell 3.0 or higher
segment.target: Windows PowerShell 3.0 or higher

segment.target: .NET Framework 4.5 or higher for UE-V 2.1.

segment.target: .NET Framework 4 or higher for UE-V 2.0.

segment.target: Standard, Enterprise, Datacenter, or Web Server

segment.target: Windows PowerShell 3.0 or higher

segment.target: .NET Framework 4.5 or higher for UE-V 2.1.

segment.target: Windows 8 and Windows 8.1

segment.source: Enterprise or Pro

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: 32-bit or 64-bit

segment.source: Also…
segment.target: Also…

segment.source: MDOP License: This technology is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: MDOP License: This technology is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: Enterprise customers can get MDOP with Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: Enterprise customers can get MDOP with Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=322049).
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=322049).

segment.source: Administrative Credentials for any computer on which you’ll be installing
segment.target: Administrative Credentials for any computer on which you’ll be installing

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The UE-V Windows PowerShell feature of the UE-V Agent requires .NET Framework 4 or higher and Windows PowerShell 3.0 or higher to be enabled.
segment.target: The UE-V Windows PowerShell feature of the UE-V Agent requires .NET Framework 4 or higher and Windows PowerShell 3.0 or higher to be enabled.

segment.source: Download Windows PowerShell 3.0 here.
segment.target: Download Windows PowerShell 3.0 here.

segment.source: Install .NET Framework 4 or .NET Framework 4.5 on computers that run the Windows 7 or the Windows Server 2008 R2 operating system.
segment.target: Install .NET Framework 4 or .NET Framework 4.5 on computers that run the Windows 7 or the Windows Server 2008 R2 operating system.

segment.source: The Windows 8, Windows 8.1, and Windows Server 2012 operating systems come with .NET Framework 4.5 installed.
segment.target: The Windows 8, Windows 8.1, and Windows Server 2012 operating systems come with .NET Framework 4.5 installed.

segment.source: The Windows 10 operating system comes with .NET Framework 4.6 installed.
segment.target: The Windows 10 operating system comes with .NET Framework 4.6 installed.

segment.source: The “Delete Roaming Cache” policy for Mandatory profiles is not supported with UE-V and should not be used.
segment.target: The “Delete Roaming Cache” policy for Mandatory profiles is not supported with UE-V and should not be used.

segment.source: There are no special random access memory (RAM) requirements specific to UE-V.
segment.target: There are no special random access memory (RAM) requirements specific to UE-V.

segment.source: Synchronization of Settings through the Sync Provider
segment.target: Synchronization of Settings through the Sync Provider

segment.source: Sync Provider is the default setting for users, which synchronizes a local cache with the settings storage location in these instances:
segment.target: Sync Provider is the default setting for users, which synchronizes a local cache with the settings storage location in these instances:

segment.source: Logon/logoff
segment.target: Logon/logoff

segment.source: Lock/unlock
segment.target: Lock/unlock

segment.source: Remote desktop connect/disconnect
segment.target: Remote desktop connect/disconnect

segment.source: Application open/close
segment.target: Application open/close

segment.source: A scheduled task manages this synchronization of settings every 30 minutes or through certain trigger events for certain applications.
segment.target: A scheduled task manages this synchronization of settings every 30 minutes or through certain trigger events for certain applications.

segment.source: For more information, see Changing the Frequency of UE-V 2.x Scheduled Tasks.
segment.target: For more information, see Changing the Frequency of UE-V 2.x Scheduled Tasks.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent synchronizes user settings for computers that are not always connected to the enterprise network (remote computers and laptops) and computers that are always connected to the network (computers that run Windows Server and host virtual desktop interface (VDI) sessions).
segment.target: The UE-V Agent synchronizes user settings for computers that are not always connected to the enterprise network (remote computers and laptops) and computers that are always connected to the network (computers that run Windows Server and host virtual desktop interface (VDI) sessions).

segment.source: Synchronization for computers with always-available connections: When you use UE-V on computers that are always connected to the network, you must configure the UE-V Agent to synchronize settings by using the SyncMethod=None parameter, which treats the settings storage server as a standard network share.
segment.target: Synchronization for computers with always-available connections: When you use UE-V on computers that are always connected to the network, you must configure the UE-V Agent to synchronize settings by using the SyncMethod=None parameter, which treats the settings storage server as a standard network share.

segment.source: In this configuration, the UE-V Agent can be configured to notify if the import of the application settings is delayed.
segment.target: In this configuration, the UE-V Agent can be configured to notify if the import of the application settings is delayed.

segment.source: Enable this configuration through one of these methods:
segment.target: Enable this configuration through one of these methods:

segment.source: During UE-V installation, at the command prompt or in a batch file, set the AgentSetup.exe parameter SyncMethod = None.
segment.target: During UE-V installation, at the command prompt or in a batch file, set the AgentSetup.exe parameter SyncMethod = None.

segment.source: Deploying the UE-V 2.x Agent provides more information.
segment.target: Deploying the UE-V 2.x Agent provides more information.

segment.source: After the UE-V installation, use the Settings Management feature in System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or the MDOP ADMX templates to push the SyncMethod = None configuration.
segment.target: After the UE-V installation, use the Settings Management feature in System Center 2012 Configuration Manager or the MDOP ADMX templates to push the SyncMethod = None configuration.

segment.source: Use Windows PowerShell or Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to set the SyncMethod = None configuration.
segment.target: Use Windows PowerShell or Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to set the SyncMethod = None configuration.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: These last two methods do not work for pooled virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) environments.
segment.target: These last two methods do not work for pooled virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) environments.

segment.source: You must restart the computer before the settings start to synchronize.
segment.target: You must restart the computer before the settings start to synchronize.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you set SyncMethod = None, any settings changes are saved directly to the server.
segment.target: If you set SyncMethod = None, any settings changes are saved directly to the server.

segment.source: If the network connection to the settings storage path is not found, then the settings changes are cached on the device and are synchronized the next time that the sync provider runs.
segment.target: If the network connection to the settings storage path is not found, then the settings changes are cached on the device and are synchronized the next time that the sync provider runs.

segment.source: If the settings storage path is not found and the user profile is removed from a pooled VDI environment on logoff, settings changes are lost and the user must reapply the change when the computer is reconnected to the settings storage path.
segment.target: If the settings storage path is not found and the user profile is removed from a pooled VDI environment on logoff, settings changes are lost and the user must reapply the change when the computer is reconnected to the settings storage path.

segment.source: Synchronization for external sync engines: The SyncMethod=External parameter specifies that if UE-V settings are written to a local folder on the user computer, then any external sync engine (such as OneDrive for Business, Work Folders, Sharepoint, or Dropbox) can be used to apply these settings to the different computers that users access.
segment.target: Synchronization for external sync engines: The SyncMethod=External parameter specifies that if UE-V settings are written to a local folder on the user computer, then any external sync engine (such as OneDrive for Business, Work Folders, Sharepoint, or Dropbox) can be used to apply these settings to the different computers that users access.

segment.source: Support for shared VDI sessions: UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 provide support for VDI sessions that are shared among end users.
segment.target: Support for shared VDI sessions: UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 provide support for VDI sessions that are shared among end users.

segment.source: You can register and configure a special VDI template, which ensures that UE-V keeps all of its functionality intact for non-persistent VDI sessions.
segment.target: You can register and configure a special VDI template, which ensures that UE-V keeps all of its functionality intact for non-persistent VDI sessions.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you do not enable VDI mode for non-persistent VDI sessions, certain features do not work, such as back-up/restore and last known good (LKG).
segment.target: If you do not enable VDI mode for non-persistent VDI sessions, certain features do not work, such as back-up/restore and last known good (LKG).

segment.source: The VDI template is provided with UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 and is typically available here after installation: C:Program FilesMicrosoft User Experience VirtualizationTemplatesVdiState.xml
segment.target: The VDI template is provided with UE-V 2.1 and 2.1 SP1 and is typically available here after installation: C:Program FilesMicrosoft User Experience VirtualizationTemplatesVdiState.xml

segment.source: Prerequisites for UE-V Generator support
segment.target: Prerequisites for UE-V Generator support

segment.source: Install the UE-V Generator on the computer that is used to create custom settings location templates.
segment.target: Install the UE-V Generator on the computer that is used to create custom settings location templates.

segment.source: This computer should be able to run the applications whose settings are synchronized.
segment.target: This computer should be able to run the applications whose settings are synchronized.

segment.source: You must be a member of the Administrators group on the computer that runs the UE-V Generator software.
segment.target: You must be a member of the Administrators group on the computer that runs the UE-V Generator software.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator must be installed on a computer that uses an NTFS file system.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator must be installed on a computer that uses an NTFS file system.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator software requires .NET Framework 4.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator software requires .NET Framework 4.

segment.source: For more information, see Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.
